intro: Chaenostoma villosum, commonly known as the silky watermilfoil, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its finely divided, soft, and hairy leaves that give it a silky appearance. The plant typically grows in shallow freshwater environments such as lakes, ponds, and slow-moving streams. It produces small, white to greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Chaenostoma villosum is often found in wetland habitats and is sometimes considered an invasive species in certain regions.
